metadata.synopsis: This dialogue takes place after the player has successfully fought back an army of goblins that attacked the druid grove. Kerrick feels ashamed for having participated in a ritual that would have driven the tieflings out, especially after having just fought beside them against the goblins.

0.speaker: Karrik
0.text: After everything that's happened, you still fought beside us.
0.context: NodeContext: Players were antagonised initially by the druids, yet still fought alongside them against a horde of attacking goblins.

2.speaker: Karrik
2.text: I don't know if we deserved your help, but I'm glad we got it.
2.context: NodeContext: Players were antagonised initially by the druids, yet still fought alongside them against a horde of attacking goblins.

1.speaker: Karrik
1.text: I hope we learn from this. We have to.
1.context: NodeContext: The grove was nearly destroyed by infighting and goblins - Karrik doesn't want it to happen again.
